intro: Amoora lepidota, commonly known as the velvet leaf or velvet tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The flowers are small and clustered, producing white or pale yellow blooms that attract pollinators.
